sentence.idiomatic: Please transfer me to Room 206.
Could I trouble you to transfer me to the Marketing Department?
I'm sorry, the front desk transferred you to the wrong line.
He has arranged to have a meal with Manager Wang.
He tried to arrange to go and see a movie with her, but she didn't have free time.
Hadn't you made an appointment? How could he not come?
He has a guest right now, perhaps it's not convenient for him to take the call.

word.literal: to be occupied with a matter

sentence.idiomatic: Are you busy right now? Is it convenient for you to come over for a moment?
We get along so well. I'm wondering if it would be convenient for you to give me your number?
The number you have dialed is busy. Please dial again later.
The boss wants to talk to you on the phone directly and ask you about work.
Who is he talking to on the phone? He's been talking for over a half an hour.
Next month he has to go out of town for an important meeting.
They are all in the conference room attending a meeting. They've been in the meeting for over an hour.
The meeting is this afternoon. How come the material isn't ready yet?
He came around 8 o'clock.
You haven't gotten in contact with me for so long. You've probably forgotten all about your old friend.
A lot of people attended his wedding yesterday. There must have been over 200 people.
Come and pick it up after 30 minutes.
After I finish eating I had better go on working.
After you graduated where did you go to work?
Hello, Truly Beautiful Incorporated.
Hi. Please transfer me to the general manager's office.
General manager's office, may I ask who's calling?
I'm from Five Star Incorporated. A couple days ago I made an appointment with Mr. Wang. Is he available to talk now?
I'm very sorry, but Mr. Wang is in a meeting now.
When will the meeting conclude?
In about an hour.
OK, then I'll call back in an hour.
